com.mellanox.jxio

Class Msg

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mellanox.jxio.Msg

  • public class Msg
extends java.lang.Object
    Msg is the object that represents a message received from or to be sent to another peer. Msg contains both OUT (ByteBuffer to which the Client writes the request and the Server writes the response) and IN buffer (ByteBuffer to which the Client receives the Response from Server and the Server receives the request from Client).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.nio.ByteBuffer getIn()
      Returns ByteBuffer to which the other side has written

      Returns ByteBuffer that will be sent to the other side

      Retrieves user context associated with this Msg

      This method sets IN & OUT ByteBuffer position to 0 and sets limit to 0

      Returns a Msg to the MsgPool to which it belongs.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • returnToParentPool

        public void returnToParentPool()
        Returns a Msg to the MsgPool to which it belongs. This method should be called only on Client side - when the application finished handling the message: only when the response from the server arrives or if Client.sendRequest failed.

      • getIn

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer getIn()
        Returns ByteBuffer to which the other side has written

        For server this will be the request from client and for client this will be the response from server

        Returns:
        ByteBuffer to which the other side has written

      • getOut

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer getOut()
        Returns ByteBuffer that will be sent to the other side

        For server this will be the response to client and for client this will be the request for server

        Returns:
        ByteBuffer that will be sent to the other side

      • getUserContext

        public java.lang.Object getUserContext()
        Retrieves user context associated with this Msg
        Returns:
        user context associated with this Msg

      • setUserContext

        public void setUserContext(java.lang.Object userContext)
        Sets user context to be associated with this Msg. It can be retrieved later
        Parameters:
        userContext - to be kept in this Msg. It can be retrieved later

      • resetPositions

        public void resetPositions()
        This method sets IN & OUT ByteBuffer position to 0 and sets limit to 0
